intro: Ligusticum tibetanicum, commonly known as Tibetan lovage, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Ligusticum tibetanicum is valued for its potential medicinal properties and is used in traditional Tibetan medicine.
